page.title: 02TRADE IN LITTLEPORT
page.content:
The biggest{shop}in Littleport is the Co-operative supermarket, while there are newsagents, chemists,butchers etc.
The main{factory}makes Burberry coats and employs many people. Mr.B.Wright has run his{saddlery}for 51 years, and his family before him, both repairing leather goods and selling them as well as tarpaulins,sports and PVC articles. He has made many saddles, as well as importing them. Thornhills{Bakery,}its factory dating from 1933, supplies 5 shops in the area. There are 10 workers making 80 different varieties of cakes. Lees{Builders}employ 8 people and a bulldog called Clementine. They have a warehouse and office and carry out plumbing, glazing etc. in a 20 mile radius. There are several lorry depots.
